results.title: Intolerance
results.brief_description:
Griffith used a variety of tinted film stock for dramatic effect on a scale seldom equalled in silent cinema. One of the most influential films in the history of cinema, on the theme of man’s intolerance throughout the ages, told in four separate but interwoven stories—’Fall of Babylon’, ‘Passion of Christ’, ‘Massacre of St. Bartholomew’ and ‘The mother and the law’—which culminate in a climax of cross cutting. Alternate versions also available on 16mm and VHS.
Credits: Director, writer, D. W. Griffith ; photography, G. W. Bitzer ; production designer, Frank “Huck” Wortman ; music, Joseph Carl Breil, D.W. Griffith ; editor, James Smith, Rose Smith.
Cast: Lillian Gish, Mae Marsh, Robert Harron, Miriam Cooper, Walter Long, Tully Marshall.

results.title: Into your hand
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Denys Brown, Stanley Hawes and Rhonda Small
results.brief_description: A plea to preserve Australia’s native animals. Describes the native fauna and how white settlement, expansion, and clearing land has effected them. Shows how animals such as the red kangaroo, possums, lizards, and ablbatross are caught and banded to enable scientists to study closely their living habits. Professor A.J. marshall questions random methods of pest killing.

results.title: Into the straight
results.creator_credit: Embassy Pictures Corporation (US), McCreadie Bros and T.O. McCreadie
results.brief_description: A melodrama, partly shot on location at Scone, N.S.W., involving romance and intrigue against a background of the world of horse racing and culminating in the Melbourne Cup. The film follows the fortunes of a racehorse breeding family, the Curzons, who need to strengthen their blood stock to re establish a fading reputation. This results in the purchase of a champion English horse, along with a father and son training team. Rivalry develops between the men for the love of the Curzon daughter, and for the attentions of a femme fatale nightclub singer, Zara Marlowe. A mock race was staged at Flemington and Randwick for the film and famous jockeys of the time, Jack Purcell and George Moore make brief personal appearances. Cast includes Charles Tingwell, Muriel Steinbeck and Nonnie Peifer.

results.title: Into secondary school (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Arnold, Nuffield Foundation and John Fletcher
results.brief_description: Application of the Nuffield mathematics course for children during their first two years of secondary school. Pupils at the Grass Royal Secondary Modern school, Yeovil and the Elliott Comprehensive, Putney are seen on their projects and the physical problems of coping with 100 children in one class session are discussed.

results.title: Into everything: providing for toddlers in child care
results.creator_credit: Video Media Production and Alex Jaye
results.brief_description: Shows how the developmental stages of pre-kindergarten children can be positively influenced by the provision of appropriate adult support and facilities in child care. Aimed at chilcare providers with little or no knowledge of cognitive and emotional stages of child development. This video emphasises that safe, colourful, cheerful and organised programs of care best facilitate proper psychomotor development. Appropriate for Professional Development and Personal Development (Home Economics).

results.title: Into Darkest Borneo
results.brief_description: The Jungles of Borneo - one of those rare places where nature has reached her greatest complexity of design. This program follows an expedition that went in search of the Purnam, lonely wanderers in Borneo’s vast jungle. Unchanged for thousands of years, the forests are the home of this tribe, their future looking increasingly bleak due to jungle clearance and the spread of civilisation. The aim of the expedition was to study the Purnam and document their way of life before it is too late. Their search took them into the heart of darkest Borneo - a trek fraught with dangers and discomforts, their quest driving them deeper and deeper into the wilderness.

results.title: Into a World of Colour
results.brief_description: Since the beginning of cinema, filmmakers experimented with colour and sound by hand-tinting frames and providing orchestral accompaniments. But it wasn’t until the early 20th century that ‘talkies’ truly changed the industry and glorious Technicolor ushered in the first golden age of cinema.

constellations_primary.name: Into a world of colour
constellations_primary.description: Filmmakers have been using colour as a method of storytelling since the first moving pictures. Colour can be used to signify emotion, intensify drama or to create a strong visual aesthetic.

results.title: Into a wider world
results.creator_credit: Extension Branch of the Girl Guides of Victoria
results.brief_description: The Extension Branch of the Girl Guides Association of Victoria was established to provide the thrill of guiding to mentally and physically disabled girls. This documentary presents some of the people and activities associated with this service by following Ethel, a young woman crippled by poliomylitis, as she is admitted to the Othopaedic Section of the Children’s Hospital at Mt Eliza and joins a group of Guides that has been established there. Through her involvement in the programs and activities, Ethel improves sufficiently to earn an income. Also shows activities at Janefield.
